overview_summary: None of the five neighbors have a documented stance on the development (0 support, 0 oppose, 5 unknown). One high-profile neighbor (a prominent conservation farmer) holds significant influence, while the others show medium to low community influence with limited public engagement.

neighbors.name: Andy F Bensend
neighbors.claims: Andy F. Bensend operates over 4,000 acres of corn and soybeans in Barron County, using no-till and other sustainable practices and running a custom farming and agronomy business ([www.morningagclips.com](https://www.morningagclips.com/wis-farmer-wins-conservation-award/#:~:text=Over%20the%20years%2C%20Bensend%20has,agronomy%20and%20nutrient%20management%20planning)). He serves as vice-president of the Wisconsin Soybean Marketing Board and often hosts field days to share conservation techniques with fellow farmers ([wisoybean.org](https://wisoybean.org/bean-bros-wisconsin-soy-growers-bridge-generations/#:~:text=young%20employee%20learning%20from%20Bensend,currently%20serves%20as%20vice%20president)) ([www.farmprogress.com](https://www.farmprogress.com/conservation-and-sustainability/sharing-soil-success#:~:text=Image%3A%20Wisconsin_20farmer3png,this%20approach%20by%20demonstrating%20them)). Bensend was honored with the American Soybean Association’s 2017 National Conservation Legacy Award for his leadership in sustainable farming ([www.morningagclips.com](https://www.morningagclips.com/wis-farmer-wins-conservation-award/#:~:text=The%20American%20Soybean%20Association%20,Courtesy%20of%20American%20Soybean%20Association)).
neighbors.influence_justification: State ag leader; large farm operator

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a peer farmer or conservation specialist approach Bensend, highlighting aspects of the project that preserve soil health and water quality.

neighbors.name: Carl & Madisen Hagen
neighbors.claims: Carl and Madisen Hagen jointly own a rural parcel in Barron County but maintain a very low public profile ([www.barroncountywi.gov](https://www.barroncountywi.gov/index.asp?SEC=D8CFD154-5CE4-4DE3-A2EC-CAC2E08FBDB6#:~:text=View%20,Schedule%20of%20Meetings)). No references to the Hagens were found in local meeting records or news, suggesting they have not publicly voiced any stance on development ([www.barroncountywi.gov](https://www.barroncountywi.gov/index.asp?SEC=D8CFD154-5CE4-4DE3-A2EC-CAC2E08FBDB6#:~:text=View%20,Schedule%20of%20Meetings)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach personally and informally to build rapport; listen to their questions and provide straightforward information, since they have no known stance yet.

neighbors.name: Steven J Bensend
neighbors.claims: Steven J. Bensend is Andy Bensend’s brother and a co-owner of the family land in Barron County, though he resides in Prescott, Wisconsin, outside the area ([drydenwire.com](https://drydenwire.com/obituaries/donna-l-bensend/#:~:text=She%20is%20survived%20by%20sons%2C,Hill%2C%20and%20Jordan%20McDonald)). He has been involved as an alumni advisor for an agricultural fraternity at UW–River Falls, but he holds no known roles in Barron County civic affairs ([wisoybean.org](https://wisoybean.org/bean-bros-wisconsin-soy-growers-bridge-generations/#:~:text=Bensend%E2%80%99s%20brother%2C%20Steven%2C%20is%20the,shared%20a%20lot%20of%20commonalities)) ([drydenwire.com](https://drydenwire.com/obituaries/donna-l-bensend/#:~:text=She%20is%20survived%20by%20sons%2C,Hill%2C%20and%20Jordan%20McDonald)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage via his brother Andy or another trusted local peer; emphasize respect for their family’s farm legacy and keep him updated as an absentee owner.

neighbors.name: Darleen P Vergin
neighbors.claims: Darleen P. Vergin is an older landowner rooted in a family that has farmed near Dallas, Wisconsin for generations ([drydenwire.com](https://drydenwire.com/obituaries/ronald-vergin/#:~:text=He%20was%20born%20July%2030%2C,to%20his%20cabin%2Fhome%20in%20Barnes)). She has no recorded involvement in local government or media discussions, indicating an absence of public stance on development issues ([www.barroncountywi.gov](https://www.barroncountywi.gov/index.asp?SEC=D8CFD154-5CE4-4DE3-A2EC-CAC2E08FBDB6#:~:text=View%20,Schedule%20of%20Meetings)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach gently through a familiar community member; emphasize respect for her family’s land legacy and reassure that the project will not disrupt the area’s rural character.

neighbors.name: Gregory W Thompson
neighbors.claims: Gregory W. Thompson holds numerous land parcels in Barron County, but unlike other Thompson family members long established in the Dallas area, he does not appear in local civic records or news outlets ([farm.ewg.org](https://farm.ewg.org/top_recips.php?fips=55005&page=5&progcode=total_cr#:~:text=109%20%20,%2414%2C152)) ([northwoodsreporter.com](https://northwoodsreporter.com/stories/569167773-who-were-the-indefinitely-confined-voters-in-barron-county#:~:text=Kearney%20Nell%20Thompson%20%20,09%2F18%2F2020)). His public profile is minimal, with no documented statements on development or community issues ([northwoodsreporter.com](https://northwoodsreporter.com/stories/569167773-who-were-the-indefinitely-confined-voters-in-barron-county#:~:text=Kearney%20Nell%20Thompson%20%20,09%2F18%2F2020)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Major acreage owner; low public engagement

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage directly with clear, businesslike communication; address any contractual or land-use questions he may have, as he tends to keep a low profile.
